Author: Alright#0419
Content: other than not really solving anything, I understand that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright there was a big medium article explaining it, but I don't feel I *really* understand it either. I believe there are edge cases, where you can stake on multiple forks at once, and people who do that "cheat" a bit and have better chances to get staking rewards

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright so the point of stake guard is to punish cheaters, automatically, giving the potentially cheated reward to finder

Author: Alright#0419
Content: your idea of "cheating" is my idea of "being clever"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you accidentally stake on multiple nodes, and some go on forks, stake guard can steal yo money

Author: Alright#0419
Content: does it actually negatively impact the network by doing it?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am not saying i think that is "cheating", but that is how it's described

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright depends on how you define things, I guess. In your opinion, it doesn't, but in Miketouts, he probably feels it does.

Content: problem with N@S is that if you start preconditioning future blocks for you to win when you win a block. over time you can end up winning all the blocks. like stake grinding
